Articles.Content:
I really don't need support on this one, I just want to rant.

It struck, the rarest species of them all, the ass kraken.

It was waiting for me. I knew it was going to strike...foolishly, I reverted two times in a row about 30 seconds apart.

32-Bit modded Ksp

Linux Ubuntu 14.04

Mods:

Karbonite

Docking Port alightment

KAS

MechJeb

The only parts in use at the the time were KAS and Karbonite

A Kerbal was on EVA and was about to hit the ground (midair) when it struck.

I was busy haxing gravity trying to get him back into his capsule...

WHY? WHY? WHYYYYYYYYYYYYY? D':

I really don't need support on this one, I just want to rant.

It struck, the rarest species of them all, the ass kraken.

It was waiting for me. I knew it was going to strike...foolishly, I reverted two times in a row about 30 seconds apart.

32-Bit modded Ksp

Linux Ubuntu 14.04

Mods:

Karbonite

Docking Port alightment

KAS

MechJeb

The only parts in use at the the time were KAS and Karbonite

A Kerbal was on EVA and was about to hit the ground (midair) when it struck.

I was busy haxing gravity trying to get him back into his capsule...

http://i.imgur.com/rAKLkej.png

WHY? WHY? WHYYYYYYYYYYYYY? D':

Calm down!

Ass Kraken

The Ass Kraken - the worst of them all

The Ass Kraken, discovered by forum user Clockwork13, is a rare kraken that occurs while loading quicksaves. It makes the screen get completely wiped out by those red fire particles that can be seen when entering atmospheres. The screen then turns white, and the game needs to be manually closed. Once the game is restarted, all of ships will disappear except for EVAs and Flags. Occasionally debris in orbit around the sun will survive. When reopening the save, it says that the parts to just about all of ships are missing. This doesn't just affect ships but also affects the research. All archives go unharmed, but random parts go missing. The node is still researched, just a lot of parts require another entry fee to gain access to them again. There seem to be varying degrees of Ass Kraken, sometimes deleting parts and ships, and other times leaving them unharmed. This is probably the most devastating, but rarest kraken.
I'm sorry for laughing for like 3 minutes at this man, really I am but it's out of feeling your pain and sharing the ridiculously brutal journey of KSP.
I'm assuming this is the equivalent of a massive nuclear explosion hitting the KSC and wiping out your stuff. Sorry
